programme.title: History: The Interesting Bits
programme.desc: Throughout history, men and women have dedicated themselves to raking in wealth in the form of old money, new money and blood money; a look at how they got it, spent it and how it affected their happiness, from Robber Barons to Mansa Musa of Mali.

programme.title: History: The Interesting Bits
programme.desc: Exploring why, from Liz Taylor to Attila the Hun, pain doesn't stop people from looking for love; how love is a driver of history, costing royalty their heads, generals their victories, and many people their sanity.

programme.title: History: The Interesting Bits
programme.desc: A look at the men and women who've run and, in some cases, won the Oval Office.

programme.title: History: The Interesting Bits
programme.sub-title: How to Get Away with It
programme.desc: A look at some of history's criminals, con artists, frauds and fakes, from Adam Worth, the 19th-century inspiration for Professor Moriarty, to a jewel thief named Diamond Doris and a count who sold the Eiffel Tower to gullible buyers twice.

programme.title: History: The Interesting Bits
programme.desc: A look at espionage; meeting spies from Delilah to Roald Dahl and along the way revealing the real model for James Bond.

programme.title: History: The Interesting Bits
programme.desc: A look at wars that lasted for centuries and others that were over in minutes, as well as the difficulty of ending a war; the possibility of starting a war over almost anything, from an unprovoked invasion to a lost ear, a pastry or a stolen bucket.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Even before the start of recorded history, ancient engineers across the World were erecting giant monuments.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A clumsy lab worker leads to the invention of superglue; the accidents behind neuroscience, beer, and chemical hair relaxant.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A failed blood pressure medicine and an unexpectedly hairy woman lead to a cure for baldness; how messing around with a scientific toy gave us the x-ray.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Gravity: It All Falls Into Place!
programme.desc: From the mysterious megaliths in prehistory to the first hot air balloons and the construction of the Giza pyramid complex, ancestors have always observed and experimented to gain a better understanding of their world.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Viruses and Bacteria: Tiny but Tough
programme.desc: A journey through the key events that have allowed people to better understand the world of microbe.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Distant ancestors were afraid of lightning and thought that it was sent by the gods; today, electricity is part of people's daily lives.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Early in their history, humans realize that they can affect nature by controlling fire, making tools and taming wild animals; what they were not given by nature, they harnessed in other species.

programme.desc: In Southern California, law enforcement hunt for a serial killer who is targeting elderly women within a few mile radius; after weeks of searching, a survivor comes forward with a description that blows the case wide open.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A serial predator terrorizes Southeastern Louisiana, strangling men to death and disposing of their bodies like trash for nearly a decade until a potential victim escapes his clutches, and then leads police right to the killer's doorstep.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: Police follow the trail of a young Southern California woman who vanishes without a trace for years until a random encounter turns them onto a chilling discovery and an even colder criminal.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.
